results.title: Roma = Fellini's Roma
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Turi Vasile and Ultra Films
results.brief_description: Fellini’s personal vision of Rome mixes travelogue, nostalgia fantasy, comedy and documentary. Inspired by his remembrances of his childhood and his sharp observations about contemporary Roman life in the seventies, the film fondly lingers over the “Felliniesque” carnival of characters populating family dinners, theater audiences, brothels, and street parties. Fellini turns Rome’s Catholic ritualism into an opulent ecclesiastical fashion show, while the subway construction sequence and the final, nocturnal tour of the ruins via motorcycle find surreal beauty in the potentially destructive juxtaposition of ancient and modern Rome. Cast includes Peter Gonzales, Fiona Florence, Marni Maitland, Anna Magnani, Federico Fellini and Gore Vidal. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ed Wood
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Tim Burton pays homage to a Hollywood visionary in this unusual, fictionalised biography of the world’s worst director, Edward D. Wood Jr. The film follows Wood in his quest for film greatness as he writes and directs turkey after turkey, cross-dresses, and surrounds himself with a motley crew of Hollywood misfits, outcasts, has-beens and never-weres. The real story however, is his friendship with ageing, morphine-addicted Bela Lugosi, for whom he tries to stage a comeback. Cast includes: Johnny Depp, Martin Landau, Sarah Jessica Parker, Patricia Arquette, Bill Murray, Jeffrey Jones and Lisa Marie.

results.title: Bent
results.creator_credit: Sean Mathias, Martin Sherman, Arts Council of Great Britain, Ask Kodansha Co, Channel Four Television Corporation and Nippon Film Development & Finance
results.brief_description: Based on Martin Sherman’s award winning stage play, ‘Bent’ focuses on the persecution of homosexual men in Nazi Germany. The story begins in the decadent gay clubs of Berlin at the close of the Weimar era, a period when homosexual expression was openly tolerated, and follows the fate of gay playboy Max (Clive Owen) and his dancer boyfriend Rudy. After Hitler increases the powers of the little-used German law, Paragraph 175, which makes homosexuality illegal, the couple are forced to spend two years on the run from the Gestapo. Finally they are caught and sent to a detention camp where Max meets and falls in love with Horst. Though the two men are subject to intense scrutiny and cannot touch, they find a way to make love. Despite his suffering, Max learns through his powerful bond with Horst that survival, like intimacy, has less to do with the flesh than with personal truth and fundamental human dignity. Cast includes Mick Jagger, Lothaire Bluteau, Brian Webber and Ian McKellen. With music by Philip Glass.

results.title: Prisoner of the mountains = Kavkazsky Plennik
results.creator_credit: Sergei Bodrov, Boris Giller, BG Productions and Karavan
results.brief_description: By all appearances, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ can easily be branded a film about the conflict in Chechnya. In fact, it was conceived well before the beginning of the war and has a short story by Leo Tolstoy, ‘Prisoner of the Caucasus’, as its basis. As the war rages in the Caucasus, young recruit Vania (Sergei Bodrov, Jr.) is sent off to the front, where he befriends a wily and experienced soldier, Sasha (Oleg Menshikov). During an ambush, the pair is captured by Muslims forces and taken prisoner to a mountain village. The leader - Abdel Murat (Djemal Sikharulidze), intends to use the soldiers as exchange currency against his son, held prisoner by the Russian army. As their stay in the village extends, a mutual understanding develops between Vania and Abdel Murat as well as a tender friendship with his daughter. However, Sasha plots to use this new found understanding as a means for achieving freedom. ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ is a powerful anti-war fable exploring the universal themes of human friendship overcoming, for a luminous moment, the barriers of language, religion, culture and other physical and mental borders. Filmed on location in Daghestan, ‘Prisoner of the Mountains’ was cast mostly with local villager. This visual feast set among stunning mountainous landscape garnered a scoop of awards and nominations, including Best Foreign Film Oscar Nomination (1996) and the Cannes Film Festival Award (1996). In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: Living in oblivion
results.creator_credit: Tom Di Cillo, Marcus Viscidi, Michael Griffiths, JDI productions and Lemon sky productions
results.brief_description: Tom Di Cillo’s acute comedy on the horrors of low-budget film making originally started life as a short film before it was extended to feature length. The unfolding dream within a dream narrative follows the perils and follies of an overworked film crew trying to get the perfect scene down on the set of a low-budget movie. Technical hiccups and budget restrictions aside, the motley group of crew members have to contend with an egotistical film star (James LeGros), a neurotic actress (Catherine Keener), their stressed out director (Steve Buscemi), his sensitive cinematographer (Dermot Mulroney), and a pissed off midget (Peter Dinklage). Clashing ego’s aside, ‘Living in oblivion’ is ultimately an affectionate tribute to the agony and ecstasy of making films and the resilient spirit of the independent film maker. Cast includes Danielle von Zerneck, Rica Martens, Kevin Corrigan, Hilary Gilford, Mathew Grace, Michael Griffiths. (Awards: 1995 Sundance Film festival, Waldo Salt screenwriting award for Tom Di Cillo, Joseph Tropiano).

results.title: Lucky Luciano
results.creator_credit: Francesco Rosi, Franco Cristaldi, Harbor Productions, Les Films de la Boetie and VIDES Cinematografica
results.brief_description: Inspired by real life events, ‘Lucky Luciano’ follows the infamous crime boss (Gian Maria Volonte) from the time he was pardoned after serving nine years of his 50-year sentence in the 1930s and 1940s, to his deportation to Italy. Once in Italy, Luciano is jailed for 10 years by narcotics investigator Charles Siragusa (playing himself in the film) who is trying to bring down a drug smuggling empire going from strength to strength. With ‘Lucky Luciano’ Rosi returns to his favourite theme, the connections between legal and illegal exercises of power (already present in films such as ‘Hands over the City’, also starring Rod Steiger). Rosi exposes the entanglement of the CIA and mob heroin-mongers during and in the years following World War II. Cast includes Edmund O’Brien, Charles Siragusa, Rod Steiger and Vincent Gardenia. The Italian-speaking actors are dubbed in English. Reference: San Francisco International Film Festival (1997). http://www.sfiff.org/festivals/1997/thefilms/html/bymaker_82.html

results.title: The Bait = L'Appat = Fresh bait [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Frederic Bourboulon, Rene Cleitman, France 2 Cinema, Hachette Premiere, Little Bear and M6 Films
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Tavernier’s “L’Appat” is a troubling tale of dreamy teenagers aspiring to travel to America and make money, fleeing their family and money troubles in France. The three central characters are linked by Nathalie (Marie Gillain)- salesgirl and aspiring model, who lives with her handsome boyfriend Eric (Olivier Sitruk) who spends most of his day watching videos with their housemate and friend, Bruno (Bruno Putzulu). Eric and Bruno come up with a plan to swindle money from well off suitors contained in Nathalie’s little black book. Things do not go to plan however and the three are forced to own up to the consequences of their actions when their botched attempts at robbery become increasingly violent. Their true natures are brought to the harsh light of day when confronted by the police as their friendship changes irrevocably. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Underground
results.creator_credit: Emir Kusturica, Pierre Spengler, CiBy 2000, Novo Film and Pandora Films
results.brief_description: An epic, wild, extremely black tragi-comedy, “Underground” traces the war torn history of Yugoslavia from World War II to Bosnia. The story focuses on two friends, Marco and Blacky, and their absurd misadventures over the last 50 years. Based on Dusan Kovacevic’s story “Once upon a time there was a country”, the characters in this film inhabit a world of self-delusion, deceit and abuse, but also of revelry, vitality and love. Kusturica’s blend of lush surrealism, wistful fantasy and dark irony, perfectly juxtapose both the hilarity and intense drama of this tale of townsfolk who, in an effort to escape the brutality of war go underground. It is both an historical documentation of the complexities of Yugoslavian politics, as well as an absurdly dark fairytale of unpredictable proportions about the absurdity of war. In Serbo-Croatian with English subtitles.

results.title: Sixteen candles
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Hilton Green and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: John Hughes spirited teen comedy stars Molly Ringwald as Samantha Baker, an average teenage girl whose awkward trek through adolescence becomes unbearable when her parents forget her sixteenth birthday. To make matters worse the high school geek (Anthony Michael Hall) starts hitting on her while Samantha negotiates her own painful crush for the handsome but taken senior, Jake Ryan (Michael Schoeffling). Aside from some moments of broad slapstick and crass stereotypes, Hughes makes some pointed observations on the trials, rituals and tribulations of American teenagers and in the process created a teen icon out of his luminous lead Molly Ringwald. “Sixteen candles” was the beginning of a very lucrative career in teen movies for Hughes who cornered the market in the 80’s with such films as “The “Breakfast club”, “Pretty in pink” and “Ferris Buellers day off”. Cast also includes John Cusack, Justin Henry, Paul Dooley, Gedde Watanabe, Jami Gertz and Joan Cusack.

results.description: John Hughes spirited teen comedy stars Molly Ringwald as Samantha Baker, an average teenage girl whose awkward trek through adolescence becomes unbearable when her parents forget her sixteenth birthday. To make matters worse the high school geek (Anthony Michael Hall) starts hitting on her while Samantha negotiates her own painful crush for the handsome but taken senior, Jake Ryan (Michael Schoeffling). Aside from some moments of broad slapstick and crass stereotypes, Hughes makes some pointed observations on the trials, rituals and tribulations of American teenagers and in the process created a teen icon out of his luminous lead Molly Ringwald. “Sixteen candles” was the beginning of a very lucrative career in teen movies for Hughes who cornered the market in the 80’s with such films as “The “Breakfast club”, “Pretty in pink” and “Ferris Buellers day off”. Cast also includes John Cusack, Justin Henry, Paul Dooley, Gedde Watanabe, Jami Gertz and Joan Cusack.

results.title: Indiscretion of an American wife = Stazione Termini
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica and Selznick Releasing Organization
results.brief_description: Mary is an American housewife trying to make the heart-rending decision of whether to go back to her husband and family or remain in Rome with her lover, Giovanni, a university professor she has met during her stay. Most of the story takes place in the Rome railway station, where Mary and Giovanni meet for one last desperate rendezvous. Their search for a secluded spot where they can be together, threatens to expose their illicit affair. However, an understanding railroad commissioner releases the two and Mary is permitted to return to her husband with an unsullied reputation. Cast includes: Jennifer Jones, Montgomery Clift, Gino Cervi and Richard Beymer.
